page.title: 18LICKHILL MANOR STOURPORT
page.content: There are 32 rooms in the house and 2 brick cellars. The house was built in the time of Willam and Mary. The land belonging to the manor now is 11 acres, it used to have 234 acres.There were no watermills but there were a couple of wells which are now dry and covered up. There was also an orchard.The land of the manor is now used as a caravan site. It is overlooked by Stagborough Hill. Each caravan has an individual garden amongst the trees. The River Severn is only 200 yds away and fishing is allowed to site residents.Stourport town centre is just a short walk away.
